intro: Launaea angolensis, commonly known as the Angola dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Launaea angolensis is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in disturbed habitats.
